definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: the merchant looked up and there was his first wife.
sentences.chinese: 商人抬起头，看到了自己的大老婆。

sentences.english: Those who were the first wives of polygamists scored similarly.
sentences.chinese: 一夫多妻制中的大老婆情况类似。

sentences.english: Mr Chana met his oldest wife, who is three years older than he is, when he was 17.
sentences.chinese: 查那先生在他17岁的时候遇到了大他3岁的大老婆。

definition: daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
mistress/the other woman (coll.)/grade 3 in elementary school
older brother's wife/sister-in-law/(polite address to a younger married woman) sister
